page.title: 02Railway station,docks.
page.content: Holyhead is the terminus for the Irish Mail trains from London.Passengers can transfer to the awaiting car ferries for passage to the Irish Republic.Two major companies run ships to Ireland, Sealink and the B&I line. There is also a container terminal at the port, this handles goods to and from Ireland.The majority of containers arrive by train but some are brought by road.the main road is the A5 trunk road.All the the cars and juggernauts travel to the ferry terminal along this road. The major part of the docks are situated in the inner harbour.The station is in the process of being modernised with extra facilities for passengers.
